intro: Gisekia miltus, commonly known as the Miltus spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring alternate, simple leaves that are often lance-shaped. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually clustered in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Gisekia miltus is known for its toxic latex, which can cause skin irritation and is a defense mechanism against herbivores.
